issues.description: The problem statement requires a public constructor for every class that takes all attributes defined in the UML (see line describing this requirement and the UML Ride attributes). In the solution repository, Ride declares the attributes and getters but does not provide the required public constructor Ride(String name, char abbreviation). Meanwhile RollerCoaster and the concrete subclasses (LaunchedDropdownTower, LaunchedRollerCoaster) call super(name, abbreviation) or super(name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings). This mismatch makes the solution self-contradictory and would cause compilation errors or confusion for students about the required constructor signature for Ride.
issues.suggested_fix: Add the required public constructor to Ride with the signature public Ride(String name, char abbreviation) that assigns the parameters to the corresponding fields. This will align the solution with the UML and the stated requirement and make the super(...) calls in subclasses valid. Ensure the constructor parameter order matches the UML (first name, then abbreviation).
